page.title: 17SACRISTON PIT P2
page.content:
The remaining 130 men will be transferred to long-life coastal pits in the east of the county.
A Sacriston miner has given us an account of his working life.
He began at sixteen years of age and works now as a coal hewer (i.e. he cuts the coal from the coal face ) having also worked on face development.
The typical working day has little variation. The is one shift beginning at 8am and lasting for seven and three quarter hours.
The face workers descend in a cage to the shaft and then walk along to Victoria seam.
